channel.title: Error 1011373133 on webclient v.3.2
channel.description:
Okay so I made another topic about this but it got washed away and I actually got one response but it was too complicated for my tiny brain to handle, I registered to make this post and that stupid quiz because I remember having lots of fun on moparscape and wish to play with the community of it again, but I keep getting this problem: I go to moparisthebest.com/, and theres a huge white box. In the top left corner, it says "Error, click for details" with a notebook paper and a red exclamation mark on the bottom next to it. I click. I get a window called Application Error. Two choices. Details, or ignore. I click details. I get a window opened that is named "Java Console", copied and pasted, this is what is inside: Java Plug-in 1.6.0_17 Using JRE version 1.6.0-oem-b104 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM User home directory = C:\Users\amy ---------------------------------------------------- c: clear console window f: finalize objects on finalization queue g: garbage collect h: display this help message l: dump classloader list m: print memory usage o: trigger logging q: hide console r: reload policy configuration s: dump system and deployment properties t: dump thread list v: dump thread stack x: clear classloader cache 0-5: set trace level to <n> ----------------------------------------------------
java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1011373133 in class file AppletBot at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1011373133 in class file AppletBot
So, the person that helped me out, Epic Steve, said this:
[quote="Epic Steve, post:2, topic:366007"]1011373133 to HEX is 3C 48 54 4D to ASCII is <HTM..
This is the start of a HTML document - This could be the start of a 404 (File not found). Make sure that the Jar file is uploaded properly and that the main class (AppletBot) is being loaded from the right package.[/quote]
I made a reply saying that I didn't understand, and I'm not familiar with coding and compiling and editting and scripting and stuff, but that's when I left and it kinda just disappeared. I'd really like to play here again and make a good first impression, but I know if I leave it there, it'll get no attention, and I'll never play here again. I'm sorry.
Thanks for the help, it is VERY appreciated. :)
EDIT: And please understand that I did look around the entire section of help for this problem and found nothing, I looked in the common compiler thread for the java.lang thing and couldn't find anything I understood there, even did google searching like that annoying quiz taught me and nothing... I AM trying.

item.title: Error 1011373133 on webclient v.3.2
item.dc:creator: @manipulator101 manipulator101
item.description:
@manipulator101 wrote:

Okay so I made another topic about this but it got washed away and I actually got one response but it was too complicated for my tiny brain to handle, I registered to make this post and that stupid quiz because I remember having lots of fun on moparscape and wish to play with the community of it again, but I keep getting this problem:
I go to moparisthebest.com/, and theres a huge white box. In the top left corner, it says “Error, click for details” with a notebook paper and a red exclamation mark on the bottom next to it. I click. I get a window called Application Error. Two choices. Details, or ignore. I click details. I get a window opened that is named “Java Console”, copied and pasted, this is what is inside:
Java Plug-in 1.6.0_17
Using JRE version 1.6.0-oem-b104 Java HotSpot™ Client VM
User home directory = C:\Users\amy

c: clear console window
f: finalize objects on finalization queue
g: garbage collect
h: display this help message
l: dump classloader list
m: print memory usage
o: trigger logging
q: hide console
r: reload policy configuration
s: dump system and deployment properties
t: dump thread list
v: dump thread stack
x: clear classloader cache
0-5: set trace level to

java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1011373133 in class file AppletBot
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Exception: java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1011373133 in class file AppletBot

So, the person that helped me out, Epic Steve, said this:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:2, topic:366007”]1011373133 to HEX is 3C 48 54 4D to ASCII is <HTM…

This is the start of a HTML document - This could be the start of a 404 (File not found).
Make sure that the Jar file is uploaded properly and that the main class (AppletBot) is being loaded from the right package.[/quote]

I made a reply saying that I didn’t understand, and I’m not familiar with coding and compiling and editting and scripting and stuff, but that’s when I left and it kinda just disappeared. I’d really like to play here again and make a good first impression, but I know if I leave it there, it’ll get no attention, and I’ll never play here again. I’m sorry.

Thanks for the help, it is VERY appreciated.

EDIT: And please understand that I did look around the entire section of help for this problem and found nothing, I looked in the common compiler thread for the java.lang thing and couldn’t find anything I understood there, even did google searching like that annoying quiz taught me and nothing… I AM trying.
